I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel that was initially republished as a series of books, and as parody. Blier wrote, directed, and even starred in “Les Valseuses” as well. "Les Valseuses" is funny, complex. and provides questions involving feminism

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on Stephenie Meyer’s novel The Host, is a story about the lives of the people who live in small town and their relationships with one another. The Film, directed by Desiree Falsioni, is also a sequel to the critically acclaimed 2007 horror-comedy of the same
